article_text:
Even New York City's marathon can't avoid fallout from the government shutdown.

Marathon officials said Thursday they are considering other staging sites for the Nov. 3 race because Fort Wadsworth on Staten Island, where the marathon launches, is federally-operated and closed due to the federal government shutdown.

Mary Wittenberg, CEO of New York Road Runners, which operates the marathon, said the organization is about 70%...

twitter.description: Due to the federal government shutdown that affects Fort Wadsworth on Staten Island, the New York City marathon may have to find a contingency staging area for more than more than 45,000 runners.
twitter.title: Marathon Finalizing Backup Staging Area
